channel.title: Blog on Brainstormer | Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Brainstormer | Blog

item.title: Are you missing anything? ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’»
item.description: I have created Brainstormer to make it easier for YOU to facilitate brainstorms. Â Maybe you tried it out, and something is not quite fitting with how you would like to brainstorm. Â Well, let’s just create the tool as you would like it! There are several ways to how you can be a part of that. Â Contributing Brainstormer is open for everyone to contribute to. If you want to take part, you can find the repository on GitHub.

item.title: BRAINSTORMER IS OPEN SOURCE! ğŸ‰
item.description: Brainstormer is all about ideas. And I am sure that everybody who uses Brainstormer has plenty of them. Â I want to invite everyone to join the development of this project. Â There are two ways for that to happen: Help plan what should be developed next, and develop it! Get the code and start remixing it to fit your own needs. You - are free to host your remixed project somewhere else as long as you also make your changes open source.

item.title: Brainstormers around the world ğŸŒ
item.description: Reviews, video tutorials and articles about Brainstormer are popping up. Â It makes me very happy to see people having productive brainstorming session all around the world! Â Video tutorials Just look at these videos that facilitators from different parts of the world, all dedicated to sharing useful resources with their peers, have been producing. Â Â ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· - South Korea Â Unfortunately I don’t understand Korean, but luckily Youtube can help with translating.

item.title: New functionality: Async brainstorming
item.description: A user of brainstormer asked me, if she could host a brainstorm, but have ideas coming in over a week. Â At first I thought that this is not exactly what I built the tool for, but I actually had a use case of my own in mind, so why not try it out. Â How to make a brainstorm with no timer? Â So - how does this new feature work?
